meanings.definition: Capable of being defended or maintained.
meanings.sent1: The tenableness of the argument was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: Her position on the matter was quite tenable and logical.
meanings.sent3: The tenableness of his excuse for being late was met with raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The tenableness of the theory was put to the test during the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The tenableness of the bridge's structure was crucial for its safety.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be supported or justified.
meanings.sent1: The tenableness of his argument was impressive and convincing.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the tenableness of the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent3: The tenableness of his decision to quit his job left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The tenableness of the company's financial stability was reassuring to investors.
meanings.sent5: The tenableness of the plan relied on accurate data and thorough research.
